Benedictine College Named a Top Pro-Life School in America



Tuesday, July 12, 2022







The national Students for Life of America organization investigated 784 Christian colleges for their pro-life stance and actions. Benedictine College and its Ravens Respect Life (RRL) student group were given an A+ and were named one of the top three pro-life colleges in America. The designation came with a $1500 “Standing with You” scholarship for a pregnant or parenting student on campus and $500 for RRL activities for the coming year.“The next step after Roe is to build a culture of life and love,” said Benedictine College President Stephen D. Minnis. “I am so proud of our students who truly ‘Love Them Both’ and support both mothers and the unborn.”According to Joe Hogan, vice president of RRL, the college and the student group were recognized for activities like these:Sidewalk advocacy trips multiple times per month, which include prayer and counseling. Annual participation in 40 Days for Life; Spring Break deployment with Susan B. Anthony List in Philadelphia; and participation in the National March for Life in Washington, D.C., with six buses of students.  Resources for pregnant and parenting students, such as diapers, formula, and blankets,are stored in RRL’s pregnant and parenting resource storage unit and given to mothers in need.Fundraising events supporting Advice & Aid Pregnancy Center in Overland Park, KS.RRL does diaper drives outside the local Walmart and provides pregnant and parenting students with brochures that have a detailed list of local pregnancy resources.  Students are working with local legislators to pass the Value Them Both Amendment, which protects basic restrictions on abortion in the State of Kansas. Any pregnant or parenting student at Benedictine can apply to receive this $1,500 scholarship at  https://www.standingwithyou.org/Scholarship/.Founded in 1858, Benedictine College is a Catholic, Benedictine, residential, liberal arts college located on the bluffs above the Missouri River in Atchison, Kansas. The school is proud to have been named one of America’s Best Colleges by U.S. News & World Report, the best private college in Kansas by The Wall Street Journal, and one of the top Catholic colleges in the nation by First Things magazine and the Newman Guide. It prides itself on outstanding academics, extraordinary faith life, strong athletic programs, and an exceptional sense of community and belonging. It has a mission to educate men and women within a community of faith and scholarship.
